definition: inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
(equivalent to 的 as possessive particle)
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
basal cell carcinoma

sentences.english: No one knows all the ins and outs of this situation.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人知道這個情況的底細。

sentences.english: You can see why the titans like it when you check the bottom lines.
sentences.chinese: 查看底細之後你就會發現巨頭們喜歡上了潔淨商業。

sentences.english: No big talk with me, I have your number.
sentences.chinese: 別跟我瞎吹了，我又不你的底細。

sentences.english: I have his number. He enjoys less popularity than most other professors.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他的底細，他不如其他的教授那樣受歡迎。

sentences.english: Let me tell you how to learn more about him .
sentences.chinese: 我來告訴你們怎麼進一步摸清他的底細。

sentences.english: I know Dixi owner, asked me to open with the drug.
sentences.chinese: 店主知我底細，隨託我開藥。

sentences.english: Don't poor-mouth to me, I have your number.
sentences.chinese: 別跟我哭窮了，我知道你的底細。
我很快就摸清了他的底細。

sentences.english: Ge ya knows ins and outs early, still maintain his composure the ground was drawn to this doctor picture.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅早知底細，仍然不動聲色地給這個博士畫了像。

sentences.english: He knows the ins and outs of this organization like a book.
sentences.chinese: 他對這個機構的底細瞭如指掌。

definition: to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
to deceive/to conceal
idle gossip
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
to set a trap
to spy upon/to lie in wait for (an opportunity)
to console
to turn a blind eye to
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
